TypeSignature.Value: public abstract class Service : Android.Content.ContextWrapper, Android.Content.IComponentCallbacks2, IDisposable, Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable

.class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit Service extends Android.Content.ContextWrapper implements class Android.Content.IComponentCallbacks, class Android.Content.IComponentCallbacks2, class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable, class System.IDisposable
type Service = class inherit ContextWrapper interface IComponentCallbacks interface IJavaObject interface IDisposable interface IJavaPeerable interface IComponentCallbacks2

Docs.summary: A Service is an application component representing either an application's desire to perform a longer-running operation while not interacting with the user or to supply functionality for other applications to use.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.App.StartCommandResult OnStartCommand (Android.Content.Intent? intent, Android.App.StartCommandFlags flags, int startId);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance valuetype Android.App.StartCommandResult OnStartCommand(class Android.Content.Intent intent, valuetype Android.App.StartCommandFlags flags, int32 startId) cil managed

abstract member OnStartCommand : Android.Content.Intent * Android.App.StartCommandFlags * int -> Android.App.StartCommandResult override this.OnStartCommand : Android.Content.Intent * Android.App.StartCommandFlags * int -> Android.App.StartCommandResult

Docs.param: The Intent supplied to android.content.Context#startService, as given. This may be null if the service is being restarted after its process has gone away, and it had previously returned anything except #START_STICKY_COMPATIBILITY.
Additional data about this start request.
A unique integer representing this specific request to start. Use with #stopSelfResult(int).
Docs.summary: Called by the system every time a client explicitly starts the service by calling android.content.Context#startService, providing the arguments it supplied and a unique integer token representing the start request.
Docs.returns: The return value indicates what semantics the system should use for the service's current started state. It may be one of the constants associated with the #START_CONTINUATION_MASK bits.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.param: The Intent that was used to bind to this service, as given to android.content.Context#bindService Context.bindService. Note that any extras that were included with the Intent at that point will not be seen here.
Docs.summary: Called when all clients have disconnected from a particular interface published by the service.
Docs.returns: Return true if you would like to have the service's #onRebind method later called when new clients bind to it.

MemberSignature.Value: public void StartForeground (int id, Android.App.Notification? notification);
.method public hidebysig instance void StartForeground(int32 id, class Android.App.Notification notification) cil managed

Docs.param: The identifier for this notification as per NotificationManager#notify(int, Notification) NotificationManager.notify(int, Notification); must not be 0.
The Notification to be displayed.
Docs.summary: If your service is started (running through Context#startService(Intent)), then also make this service run in the foreground, supplying the ongoing notification to be shown to the user while in this state.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.param: The identifier for this notification as per NotificationManager#notify(int, Notification) NotificationManager.notify(int, Notification); must not be 0.
The Notification to be displayed.
must be a subset flags of manifest attribute android.R.attr#foregroundServiceType flags.
Docs.summary: An overloaded version of #startForeground(int, Notification) with additional foregroundServiceType parameter.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool StopSelfResult(int32 startId) cil managed

Docs.param: The most recent start identifier received in #onStart.
Docs.summary: Stop the service if the most recent time it was started was <var>startId</var>.
Docs.returns: Returns true if the startId matches the last start request and the service will be stopped, else false.
